data.enText: to become or make sth become firm, stiff or solid

data.chText: 清漆需要几个小时才能干透。
data.enText: The varnish takes a few hours to harden.

data.chText: 硬化和保存木料的方法
data.enText: a method for hardening and preserving wood

data.chText: （使声音、面孔等）更严肃，更严厉
data.enText: if your voice, face, etc. hardens , or you harden it, it becomes more serious or severe

data.chText: 她的脸沉下来，面带恨意。
data.enText: Her face hardened into an expression of hatred.

data.chText: 看到她没在听他讲话，他声音严厉起来。
data.enText: He hardened his voice when he saw she wasn't listening.
if sb's feelings or attitudes harden or sb/sth hardens them, they become more fixed and determined

data.chText: 公众对这次罢工所持的态度已强硬起来。
data.enText: Public attitudes to the strike have hardened.

data.chText: 这件事使她更加坚定了离开公司的决心。
data.enText: The incident hardened her resolve to leave the company.

data.chText: 使变得无情；使不被打动
data.enText: to make sb less kind or less affected by extreme situations

data.chText: 乔让人觉得变了，让战争变得冷酷无情了。
data.enText: Joe sounded different, hardened by the war.

data.chText: 他们都是死不悔改的罪犯。
data.enText: They were hardened criminals (= they showed no regret for their crimes) .

data.chText: 做这项工作面对伤痛和病患时你得保持冷静心情。
data.enText: In this job you have to harden your heart to pain and suffering.

data.chText: 对单亲家庭态度的冷漠化
data.enText: a hardening of attitudes towards one-parent families

tr: cause to accept or become hardened to
example: He was inured to the cold
This trip will season even the hardiest traveller

tr: harden by reheating and cooling in oil

value.def: When something hardens or when you harden it, it becomes stiff or firm.

example.ex: Mould the mixture into shape while hot, before it hardens...
example.tran: 在混合物还没有变硬之前，趁热将它塑成形。

example.ex: Give the cardboard two or three coats of varnish to harden it.
example.tran: 在纸板上涂两三层清漆使其变硬。

value.def: When an attitude or opinion hardens or is hardened, it becomes harsher, stronger, or fixed.

example.ex: Their action can only serve to harden the attitude of landowners...
example.tran: 他们的行动只会让土地拥有者的态度变得更坚定。

example.ex: The bitter split which has developed within Solidarity is likely to harden further into separation.
example.tran: 团结工会内部已产生的不愉快分歧可能会进一步演变为分裂。

value.tran: （使）（态度、想法）变得更坚定;（使）变得更强硬

example.ex: ...a hardening of the government's attitude towards rebellious parts of the army.
example.tran: 政府对待部队中反叛分子的态度更强硬

value.def: When prices and economies harden, they become much more stable than they were.

example.ex: Property prices are just beginning to harden again.
example.tran: 房地产价格刚开始重新趋于稳定。

value.def: When events harden people or when people harden, they become less easily affected emotionally and less sympathetic and gentle than they were before.

example.ex: Her years of drunken bickering hardened my heart...
example.tran: 她多年来醉酒寻衅的恶习让我变得麻木。

example.ex: She was hardened by the rigours of the Siberian steppes...
example.tran: 西伯利亚大草原的艰苦环境使她变得坚强起来。

example.ex: All of a sudden my heart hardened against her.
example.tran: 突然间我对她硬起了心肠。

value.tran: （使）变得坚强;（使）变得冷酷无情;（使）变得麻木不仁

value.def: If you say that someone's face or eyes harden, you mean that they suddenly look serious or angry.

example.ex: His smile died and the look in his face hardened.
example.tran: 他的笑容消失了，脸上的表情严肃了起来。

value.tran: （表情、眼神）变得严肃，变得不快
